data.title: Why not include mono inside the OSX app?
data.body: As a mac user and dev, I strongly believe you should take advantage of the OSX app system and include ALL necessary libraries inside your release app bundles, including mono.  Apps like Gnomoria have done it just fine, why not OpenRA as well?   Just looking at Gnomoria the libraries involved are probably only a few extra mb and is far, far better then having to give our whole system mono just for the one app.  Have you guys looked into it?  Is there a reason it must be a separate download?

data.title: Fix non-selectable support actor health bars.

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
#11862 had an unintended side-effect of enabling health bar rendering for actors that have the `SelectionDecorations` trait but not `Selectable` (previously it required both).

This goes through and explicitly disables the health bars for _most_ of the actors that didn't show them before, either by removing `SelectionDecorations` completely (fields, flags, and that nasty `Colt` actor) or keeping `SelectionDecorations` but disabling health bars (badgers, C&C landing craft, KOTH capture points, barrels, ammo boxes, oil derrick husks).

This keeps the accidentally enabled health bars for the support chinooks and landing craft in missions: these are normal actors that you just can't control, so I figured it made sense to keep the bars for these.

Fixes #12145.

data.title: Work around an initialisation order conflict in RenderRangeCircle.

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body: Fixes #12164.  That map includes custom rules that for some non-obvious reason shuffles the initialization order and breaks the implicit ordering assumption.

data.title: Marshal results in QueryDevices correctly

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
Fixes #12150.

On Windows systems, `Marshal.PtrToStringAuto` marshals to Unicode on "recent" (2000, XP, and later) Windows OSes. This doesn't appear to be the encoding of the text and therefore results in sadness.

Rather than using both `Marshal.PtrToStringX` and `Encoding.Y` and risk having the two be out of sync we can make things simpler by marshalling the buffer as null-separated bytes. Then all we have to do is guess the right encoding. I'm hoping our current choice of the system code page (`Encoding.Default`) is correct. It depends what `alcGetString` is using as the encoding (the documentation does not clarify).

Works on my machine - if anybody has sound devices that have non-ASCII names it would be great if you could verify this!

data.title: Fatal error after downgrading to "release"
data.body:
I am using Opensuse linux 42.1 and my openra version is the newest playtest. First I had the previous playtest, then downgraded to release. After first downgrading it I have not been able to launch the game and I am getting a "Openra has encountered a fatal error".

[exception-2016-10-03T192051Z.txt](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/files/507012/exception-2016-10-03T192051Z.txt)

I tried deleting  ~/.openra/ with all of its contents without any luck.

data.title: TD Grenadier Crush Idea.
data.body:
When the time allows since I know everyone is busy :D if it would be possible to allow a mechanic of grenadier crushing.

A vehicle such as a light tank crushes a grenadier and causes damage to vehicles. Would help prevent some of the mass crushing issues vs GDI and give another reason to mix some Grenadiers in the infantry builds.

This is a mechanic idea similar to #11415

data.title: Missing range indicator for defense structures

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
Version: playtest20161001
Mod: Red Alert
Map: Desert Rat

Issue: The range indicator appears for Flame Tower, Tesla Coil, Turret, AA-Gun and SAM-Site **only** after placing them.
For pillboxes and camo-pillboxes, you can see the indicator before and after placing the building.

![indicator](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20945684/19046092/28ada3b4-899c-11e6-9d6e-a9533f28e35d.png)

data.title: Fix yaks trying to attack invalid targets

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
Fixes #12128.
You can test this by placing a lot of camo pillboxes.

I removed the `yak.Wait(DateTime.Seconds(5))` as it just seems to make the yak stay in air without moving.

data.title: OpenRA: AI will not deploy new MCV

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
After killing the MCV of an AI opponent, the AI will make a new MCV (if it has the service depot and war factory intact), but let the MCV idle around without deploying. 

This problem was first introduced in **Playtest 20160904.** 

Something in the codebase change between **release 20160508** and the previously mentioned playtest caused this. As I do not have any programming skills (I am learning some basic stuff in my little spare time) I can not fix it.

Reproducing the bug is easy, just let the AI make a warfactory and service depot and kill of the MCV.

data.title: Add AreaBeam target tracking
data.body:
Adds support for target tracking to `AreaBeam` and enables it on TS Sonic tank weapon.

Closes #10181.

data.title: Forbidden maps should not be automaticly updated with new release
data.body:
http://resource.openra.net/maps/13484/
This map was already forbidden and you can download it now

data.title: Support subtraction of two CPos in Lua
data.body:
Fixes #11667, based off of [WPos already supporting this](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/OpenRA.Game/WPos.cs#L93). I also tweaked the exception text as well (if this is fine, WPos could get updated too).

For testing I dropped this in the WorldLoaded function on a scripted map:

```
local pos1 = CPos.New(10, 10)
local vec1 = CVec.New(5, 5)
local a = pos1 - vec1
Media.DisplayMessage("CPos{10,10} - CVec{5,5} >> expected {5,5}, actual {" .. a.X .. "," .. a.Y .. "}")

local pos2 = CPos.New(10, 10)
local pos3 = CPos.New(5, 5)
local b = pos2 - pos3
Media.DisplayMessage("CPos{10,10} - CPos{5,5} >> expected {5,5}, actual {" .. b.X .. "," .. b.Y .. "}")
```

data.title: Fixes sprite barrels ignoring turret/actor orientation in previews
data.body:
Fixes #12154.

Affects color picker, map editor and transport via TS carryall or TD landing craft.

data.title: WithSpriteBarrel ignores turret facing in actor previews
Minor Game style fixes.
Fix line endings in LobbyLogic.
Extract a common SHA1 helper.
data.body:
This removes some duplication by replacing all the DIY sha1 calculations with a set of helpers.

The CryptoUtil class will grow a lot more code for #2265: this is just the first step to reduce the size of future PRs.

data.title: Settings - Audio - Audio Device showing unknown characters

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
Seen in Windows binaries of "playtest-20161001", and "playtest-20160904", did not appear on "release-20160508": from main menu open "Settings", click on tab "Audio", and open drop down "Audio Device".
![2016-10-02_11-09-26](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3417544/19019760/59e5e532-8892-11e6-93dd-8c9061635e4f.png)
The "Default Output" option is shown as expected, but any other audio device option is showing only a mixture of small rectangles and a few extra signs.
Trying to select any of these "crapped" audio device options, and restarting OpenRA will not change audio output away from default.
I have seen this on all three Mods in both "playtest-" Windows builts. PC is Win8.1-64bit. I did not test on any other platform.

data.title: Checkbox for muting lobby and game chat beep sound
data.body:
I want a checkbox somewhere to be able to mute the lobby and game chat beep sound effect.
Less importantly, the menu sound effect too.

data.title: Prevent TickRender from running before the world's first Tick.
data.body:
If one or more clients in a MP game takes significantly longer than the rest to load it will suppress the trait `Tick`s for all the faster clients, but not the `RenderTick`s.  This is a problem, because there are cases where `RenderTick` relies on state that is initialized by `Tick`.

Fixes #11279.

The following patch introduces a simple repro case to help with testing (needs at least two real clients):

``` diff
diff --git a/OpenRA.Game/Game.cs b/OpenRA.Game/Game.cs
index d9ccb31..0ce3098 100644
--- a/OpenRA.Game/Game.cs
+++ b/OpenRA.Game/Game.cs
@@ -165,6 +165,9 @@ internal static void StartGame(string mapUID, WorldType type)
                        using (new PerfTimer("NewWorld"))
                                OrderManager.World = new World(map, OrderManager, type);

+                       if (!IsHost)
+                               Thread.Sleep(5000);
+
                        worldRenderer = new WorldRenderer(ModData, OrderManager.World);

                        using (new PerfTimer("LoadComplete"))
```
